the water is still rising in parts of

through Saturday she says the County's

we will do what is right

and it's my belief that our state will

for Labor Day the labor department is
set to report on the nation's job market
NPR Scott Horsley reports forecasters
think employers added about 170 000 jobs
last month forecasters think the pace of
hiring has slowed compared to the
beginning of the year but employers are
still adding a respectable number of
jobs each month and the unemployment
rates expect to remain historically low
around three and a half percent
other indicators do point to a cooling
job market job openings have declined
though there are still three vacancies
for every two unemployed workers and the
number of workers quitting jobs has come
down so employers aren't having to deal
with quite so much turnover today's
report is also expected to show that
wage growth slowed in August but in a
turnaround wages are now climbing faster
than prices so workers have seen real
Improvement in their buying power it's
